docs.lead_paragraph: Americans with accounts on President Barack Obama's health insurance enrollment website, HealthCare.gov, were advised that their passwords had been reset to guard against the "Heartbleed" bug, in a message posted on the site on Saturday.

headline.main: Obamacare Enrollees Urged to Change Passwords Over Heartbleed Bug

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge has rejected an effort by American Airlines to quickly cut off benefits for many of its retirees. American, which is in bankruptcy, wants retirees who wish to keep their benefits to pay all the cost.

headline.main: Effort by American Airlines to Cut Benefits Fails
headline.print_headline: Effort by American Airlines to Cut Benefits Fails

docs.abstract: United States Bankruptcy Court Judge Sean H Lane in New York rejects effort by former American Airlines parent AMR Corporation to quickly cut off benefits for many of its retirees; grants request for group of nonunion workers.
docs.snippet: A federal judge has rejected an effort by American Airlines to quickly cut off benefits for many of its retirees. American, which is in bankruptcy, wants retirees who wish to keep their benefits to pay all the cost.

docs.lead_paragraph: Policy experts wonder whether the government and private businesses can control spending as the economy gets stronger and millions more Americans gain coverage.

headline.main: Health Care Spending’s Recent Surge Stirs Unease
headline.print_headline: Health Care Spending’s Recent Surge Stirs Unease

docs.snippet: Policy experts wonder whether the government and private businesses can control spending as the economy gets stronger and millions more Americans gain coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: Regardless of whether you agree with the Democrats or Republicans on health reform, it could have profound implications on the midterm elections.
docs.abstract: Charles M Blow Op-Ed column warns continued Republican opposition to Affordable Care Act, despite its success, may prove political liability to Democrats in midterm elections unless they fight back; faults Democrats for lacking backbone and urges strong response to Republican attacks by rallying both facts and supporters to their advantage.
docs.snippet: Regardless of whether you agree with the Democrats or Republicans on health reform, it could have profound implications on the midterm elections.

docs.lead_paragraph: The bug that rattled the Internet last week exposed the paradox that some of the web’s most crucial coding depends on the efforts of volunteers.

headline.main: Heartbleed Highlights a Contradiction in the Web
headline.print_headline: A Contradiction at the Heart of the Web

docs.abstract: Heartbleed bug that rattled Internet exposes the paradox that some of web’s most crucial coding, on sites from Google to Amazon to Federal Bureau of Investigation, depends on efforts of volunteers programmers known as open-source community.
docs.snippet: The bug that rattled the Internet last week exposed the paradox that some of the web’s most crucial coding depends on the efforts of volunteers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Now that the Affordable Care Act is proving to be even more successful than expected, it’s time for Democrats to stand up for it.

headline.main: How to Run on Health Reform
headline.print_headline: How to Run on Health Reform

docs.abstract: Editorial urges Democratic congressional candidates to capitalize on success of Affordable Care Act, which has signed eight million people on, and to use it to remind voters what government can accomplish.
